profile_positions.description:
•	Drafted decisions at the pre-trial and trial stages related to the admission of evidence, the disclosure of witness and exhibit lists, and orders terminating provisional release.
•	Assisted in drafting a memorandum for the Office of the President on fair trial rights at the appeals level.
•	Conducted legal research and provided legal and factual analysis on a variety of issues including preliminary motions related to the form of the indictment.
•	Researched substantive legal issues and assisted in the drafting of a MICT Judge’s speech regarding crimes against humanity, which was given at a judicial colloquium for national, regional, and international judges at the MICT branch in Arusha, Tanzania.
•	Amalgamated extracts of precedent-setting jurisprudence from MICT, ICTR, and ICTY Appeals Chambers judgements and decisions to be used in the MICT Case Law Database.
•	Reviewed pre-trial, trial, and appeals level draft decisions and orders for grammatical consistency and for accuracy of referenced sources and materials.
•	Assisted in redacting confidential decisions and orders to make them available to the public and carefully scanned documents to remove identifying information of protected victims and witnesses.
•	Prepared summaries of witnesses’ testimony.
•	Used e-Court to manage documentary evidence during trial.
•	Exercised discretion while working on highly sensitive cases and with confidential information.
•	Developed strong cross-cultural communication skills while working on teams with diverse backgrounds.
•	Developed a working knowledge of case management software, such as TRIM, LiveNote, and Ringtail, by participating in trainings and applying the skills learned.
•	Gained insight into the roles and responsibilities of defence teams by liaising with defence counsel during ADC-ICT continuing education programs, including a one-week Mock Trial and a full day advocacy training on Forensic and DNA Evidence.
profile_positions.title: Law Clerk to Chambers

profile_positions.description:
•	Conducted domestic criminal law research and drafted appellate briefs which dealt with issues such as the fair trial rights of the defendant at trial, and disputes relating to fines and fees.
•	Compressed voluminous trial records into a single document for pending appeals cases, which entailed summarising documentary evidence, trial testimony, and the post-conviction hearings.
•	Conducted targeted legal research of appellate jurisprudence regarding the essential elements of the crime of burglary.
•	Litigated criminal cases before judges in my domestic jurisdiction under the supervision of assistant state’s attorneys and acted with the same rights and responsibilities that a licensed attorney would have.
•	Presented opening and closing statements at contested hearings regarding motions to supress evidence and on charges including aggravated unlawful use of a weapon.
•	Submitted requests for discovery and organized binders for pending criminal trials.
•	Adhered to tight deadlines and worked independently and efficiently in a time-pressured environment where there was a sizeable caseload.
•	Interacted with victims of violent felonies and notified them of the pending trial against their offenders.
•	Included felony victims in the disposition of cases against their offenders by providing an opportunity for victims to voice their desired outcome of the proceedings, including sentencing.
